p: For the HA-NA- HA and PB1-NA- PB1 viruses, a series of ten additional passages was performed. The titre for HA-NA- HA consistently remained more than 3 log 10 below that of wild-type ( Fig. 2c), with segment 6 packaging still impaired ( Fig. 2c, right panel). On the contrary, for PB1-NA- PB1, titres increased very slowly during these additional ten passages, almost reaching wild-type levels ( Fig. 2c), and the incorporation efficiency of the NA segment also improved, although it was not totally restored ( Fig. 2c, right panel). The ratio of infectivity expressed in genomic RNA copies per infectious unit was in agreement with the observed fitness ( Table 1).
